content: side of your piece slip_stitch seam d towards the neck opening b sl st side seam f towards arm opening a slip_stitch side seam c towards arm opening a now the poncho is finished optional continue attaching the sleeves 4 tunisian poncho sweater sleeves the sleeves are made to fit the upper part of your lower arm just try and see what width gives the best fit for you however make sure the amount of starting chs can be divided by 2 the sleeves are worked in the round ending each row with a slip_stitch in the chain use a crochet hook size 7mm the turning chains count as a st do not turn your work but keep working on the right side chain 28 or amount of chain neede for your size slip_stitch in the 1st chain to make a ring round 1 chain 2 skip 1st chain same as in which you made the slip_stitch half_double_crochet in each chain 27 half_double_crochet close round with a slip_stitch in 2nd chain round 2-8 chain 2 *fphdc bphdc* repeat * around close round with a slip_stitch in 2nd chain round 9 chain 2 half_double_crochet in each st close round with a slip_stitch in 2nd chain fasten_off turn your poncho inside out showing wrong side align the sleeve and move it in to the arm opening slip_stitch the sleeve together with the arm opening weave in all yarn ends congratulations your poncho sweater is finished 5 tunisian poncho sweater size xl-xxxl for this size you will need 1 more skein of mint green measurements the width will be 82 stitches the length needs to be 68 row times 2 so the color scheme on this page is 138 row 2 times 68 row follow the pattern but use these measurements and color scheme ©madebyjori jori wagenaars this pattern is copyright to madebyjori this is a free pattern however please do not copy or sell my pattern products made with madebyjori patterns may be sold however i would appreciate it when you credit me by linking to my shop https //www etsy com/shop/madebyjori or https //www ravelry com/designers/jori-wagenaars 6
